Issues.Title: feat(common): add ability to retrieve the state from Location service
Issues.Body:
Previously there wasn't a way to retrieve `history.state` from the `Location` service. The only time the framework exposed this value was in navigation events. This meant if you weren't using the Angular router, there wasn't a way to get access to this `history.state` value other than going directly to the DOM.

This PR adds an API to retrieve the value of `history.state`. This will be useful and needed to provide a backwards-compatible `Location` service that can emulate AngularJS's `$location` service since we will need to be able to read the state data in order to produce AngularJS location transition events.

This feature will additionally be useful to any application that wants to access state data through Angular rather than going directly to the DOM APIs.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(common): add ability to retrieve the state from Location service" (#28581)

Issues.Title: Location service not provided in CommonModule
Issues.Body:
The `Location` service is used by the Angular Router. But it's difficult to use outside the router because it's not provided in the `CommonModule`. Instead, it's configured to be provided in the [RouterModule](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/router/src/router_module.ts#L58).

All existing examples I can find use the Router, so they wouldn't break. However, this makes it difficult to use `Location` on it's own.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Location service not provided in CommonModule" (#28580)

Issues.Title: [Feature Request] Add feature to make operations with Animation parameters
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
 This feature request is for @angular/animations


### Description
Feature that enables to make operations on angular animation parameters.


### Describe the solution you'd like
Okay lets we have animation for router:

```
export const scaleDownLeft = animation( [
    query(':enter, :leave', style(sharedStyles)
        , { optional: true }),
        group([
          query(':enter', [
            animate('{{timing}}s {{delay}}s ease-in', keyframes([
             style({transform: 'translateX(-100%)', offset: 0}),
             style( { transform: 'translateX(0%)', offset: 1})
            ])
            )
          ], { optional: true }),
            query(':leave', [
            animate('{{timing}}s {{delay}}s ease-in', keyframes([
              style({ opacity: '1', transform: 'scale(1)', offset: 0}),
              style({ opacity: '0', transform: 'scale(0.8)', offset: 1})
            ]))
          ], { optional: true }),
        ]),
    ], {params: {timing: '0.5', delay: '0'}});
```
and in ts:
```
  animations: [
  trigger('scaleDownLeft', [transition('* => *', useAnimation(scaleDownLeft, {
      params: { timing: '0.5', delay: '0' }
    }))])
   ]
```
As you can see I am passing parameter timing to animate function but in the query(':leave) section want 0.6 instead of 0.5 so something like this

animate('{{timing + 0.1}}s {{delay}}s ease-in'
But unfortunately it is not supported now and angular throws error 'The provided timing value is invalid.'

Stackblitz: [DEMO](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-router-transition-playground-mlizkr?file=src%2Fapp%2Fanimations.ts)

### Describe alternatives you've considered

Alternative solution would be to provide timing separately for each query but it does not suit if you publish library since users have no idea how enter and leave time is related.

Issues.Title: fix(ivy): properly query root nodes of embedded views(shallow queries)
Issues.Body:
This PR fixes FW-803 (Queries for root nodes of embedded views aren't working properly).

While fixing this bug and going through the existing query logic I've realised that:
* with the current implementation a content child / children query can select a host node on which it is defined - while this is the behaviour of the view engine, it is also very counter-intuitive and was reported as a bug (#10098) breaking several real-life use cases;
* the fact that a query can match its host significantly contributes to the queries code complexity so actually fixing makes the query code smaller and easier to follow.

Given the above this PR can be seen as:
* a fix for FW-803;
* a fix for #10098
* a refactoring that significantly simplifies existing queries code (several methods with non-trivial branching logic are simplified - `getOrCreateCurrentQueries ` goes away and `addNode` becomes trivial).

**Note**:  a fix for #10098 could be seen as a breaking change, as proven by the needed fix to the `routerLinkActive` directive. It is definitively a change in behaviour but I would argue that this is a fix / improvement as previously people had trouble properly write tree-like directives. Not to mention that  `ContentChild` \ `ContentChildren` name indicates that a query should look for its children (and not try to match itself).

**Note**:  @IgorMinar `public_api_guard/router/router.d.ts` file changed suggesting that we are changing public API. While it is true, technically speaking, real-life impact should not be visible to users:
* usage in templates doesn't change;
* if someone instantiates the `routerLinkActive` directly (calling its constructor) it should have no impact either as new arguments are optional.

# üêû Bug report

### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are effected by this bug? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```

- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Is this a regression?

I suspect this is a regression introduced by https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/pull/13062.

### Description

I believe one used to be able to configure through angular.json such that Karma tests would not include the `karma-source-map-support` plugin. It can now however seem like this plugin is mistakenly always included.

1. Even though I specify `"sourceMap": false` in `angular.json`

2. Config is [normalized](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/v7.2.3/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/karma/index.ts#L42-L46)

3. `sourceMap` option is [further normalized](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/v7.2.3/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/utils/normalize-builder-schema.ts#L59)

4. Normalization of `sourceMap` always ends up with [an object](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/v7.2.3/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/utils/normalize-source-maps.ts#L17-L22)

5. `source-map-support` is [conditionally included](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/blob/v7.2.3/packages/angular_devkit/build_angular/src/angular-cli-files/plugins/karma.ts#L80-L93), but the condition is always true

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

```
$ ng new foo
$ cd foo
$ npm install karma-jsdom-launcher jsdom
$ sed -i 's/Chrome/jsdom/g' src/karma.conf.js
$ sed -i 's/chrome/jsdom/g' src/karma.conf.js
```

Then run `ng test` and watch the process never exit.

## üî• Exception or Error

I was made aware of this issue in https://github.com/badeball/karma-jsdom-launcher/issues/27. Project of said issue aims to allow `jsdom` to be used as a target browser. Making synchronous requests like `source-map-support` does will create a deadlock and halt execution indefinitely.

# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
```
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [x ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc
```

### Description
It would be a great feature to have the possibility to add the newly generated component|class|service|... to a barrel file when using the ng generate <c|s|class|...>.


### Describe the solution you'd like
The barrel exportation could be an option that is defaulted to false. The exportation would be in the module of the generated item if any index.ts file is present:
#### Examples
##### The folder diagram
```

o
| --core
|   | --core.module.ts
|   | --index.ts  // core module's barrel
|   | --services
|   `-- models
|-- pages
|   |-- pages.module.ts
|   |-- index.ts // pages module's barrel
|   |-- dashboard
|   |   |-- dashboard.module.ts
|   |   `-- index.ts  // dashboard module's barrel. 
|    | `-- about
|       |-- about.module.ts // This module doesn't have any barrel
|       `-- about // about component folder is exported in index.ts of about module's barrel
    `-- shared // more folder for style
```

##### Generating a module with barrels enabled
```
ng g m pages/about
```
Generate a module without any barrels in it. If the user had specified `-b` an `index.ts` file would have been created.


##### Generating a new service with the shorthand syntax
```
ng generate service core/services/myService -b
```
This generate a new service named MyService and it is exported in the "closest" relative module. That means that the `index.ts` is in the core folder


##### Generating a new component with the long syntax
```
ng generate component pages/dashboard/dash --barrel
```
This generate a new component named DashComponent in the "closest" relative module. That means that the `index.ts` is in the dashboard folder.

##### Generating a new component that has no barrel 
```
ng generate component /pages/about/me -b
```
This still generate the component, but does not add anything to any barrel because the module it belongs to doesn't have one

##### Generating a new component that has no barrel 
```
ng generate component /pages/about/me -b=pages
```
This generate a new component named MeComponent in specified module. That means that the `index.ts` is in the pages folder.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
There is currently a library doing this: https://www.npmjs.com/package/barrelsby, but we have to run a separate command everytime we create a new item, a lot of configuration is needed as well and there is a devDependency.

Issues.Title: refactor(drag-drop): don't clone items array inside withItems
Issues.Body:
Currently when the consumer passes in an array of items to `withItems`, we clone the array which means that the indices won't update if the consumer shuffles them around. The original rationale behind it was to avoid accidentally mutating the array, however this makes it less convenient to use since the consumer would have to remember to move the item in the array __and__ call `withItems` in order to keep everything in sync when an item is dropped.

These changes remove the cloning and use `ReadonlyArray` to prevent us from accidentally making changes.

Fixes #15089.

Issues.Title: [drag-drop] allow sort customizatoin
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Currently, sorting on drag move is done in `DropListRef._sortItems`. This means that
the user can't modify the sort logic and/or perform other operations when sorting occurs.

We should be able to tap into the sorting process, react to it and or override it.

Right now we can override it by inheriting `DropListRef` and implementing `_sortItems`.

This is not the best solution because:

- It requires a modified `DragDrop` service (extending class) that will return our modified ref class.
- A lot of internal logic within `_sortItems` is not accessible, making it impossible to use. This mainly refers to private methods and members in `DropListRef`, examples:
  -  The `_itemPositions` cache is private which is the main data we work with on sort.
  - Methods like `_getItemIndexFromPointerPosition`, `_getItemOffsetPx` etc..

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

Being able to modify and tap into the sort event has a lot of use cases, for example:

- **Apply the impact of sort on other elements.**
A column header cell in a table is draggable, once sorted it will move (along with other items in the drop list). We also want to move all cell in the data rows that "belong" to that column...

![2sw6s1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5377501/52274652-fb80ec00-2955-11e9-908a-8ed836b4967b.gif)

When a column header cell moves, all data row cells of that column will move as well...

- **Skip sorting within the drop-list**
We might want to prevent the move of an item **within** the drop-list. Right now we can only prevent **entering** a drop list.

![2sw737](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5377501/52274801-6c280880-2956-11e9-8463-afeb0751f8ce.gif)

> This can probably get done with a "in-drop-list" predicate but it's one use-case out of many.

#### Is there anything else we should know?

I think an API to tap into the sort is the best solution and ofcourse exposing the helper methods (protected?)...

If exposing the item position cache is a problem (even in protected?) maybe an API to sort that provide this to the sort function can help...
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[drag-drop] allow sort customizatoin" (#15087)

Issues.Title: [drag-drop] allow changing the element of a DropListRef
Issues.Body:
#### Please describe the feature you would like to request.

Allow changing `element` in `DropListRef`, similar to how it is done in `DragRef` 

#### What is the use-case or motivation for this proposal?

Currently, in `DragRef` we can use `withRootElement()` to change the element, host of the dragged item. In `DropListRef` this is not the case, the element is `readonly` and can not change.

There are scenarios where the `element` we want to for the container is not reachable, mostly when it is in a component.

```html
<cdk-table cdkDropList></cdk-table>
```
 
Now if we want to to have a specific element inside the table to act as the drop container we cant...

I've already raised a somewhat [similar issue](https://github.com/angular/material2/pull/14153) with the proposal to add an `@Input()` to `cdkDropList` but the main concern was exposing an input on the directive for this specific use case that will have to be maintained...

Now that we have a service, one might choose to implement this feature (or not) in his own directive.

E.g.: Use an `@Input()` that accepts a query selector string and replace the element based on that.

I don't see any reason why we can't change it (maybe there is?). It does not have any event registered so it should be quite simple...

Issues.Title: perf(focus-monitor): avoid triggering change detection if there are no subscribers to stream
Issues.Body:
This is a resubmit of #14964.

Currently we have an `NgZone.run` call on each `focus` and `blur` event of a monitored event in order to bring its subscribers into the `NgZone`, however this means that we're also triggering change detection to any consumers that aren't subscribed to changes (e.g. `mat-button` only cares about the classes being applied). These changes move around some logic so that the `NgZone.run` is only hit if somebody has subscribed to the observable.

**Caretaker note:** this PR had to be reverted before (#15076) because there was an app that depended on the extra change detections. We may have to investigate further before we can merge this in again.
